Welcome to Flask Classification 2022 A’s documentation!

Indices and tables

  • Index

  • Module Index

  • Search Page

app.routes.classifications_upload.classifications_upload()

API for selecting a model and uploading an image from the user computer and running classification job. Returns the output scores from the model.

This module implements the following functions: - Create a plot of the results with pyplot. - Provide the plot in a downloadable format as a route.

app.routes.download_plot.create_plot(data: dict, filename: str)

Creates a figure and saves it.

Parameters

data: dictionary with keys and values that represent the x and y data. filename: name of the png file

app.routes.download_plot.get_plot_for_download(job_id)

Connects to redis, gets the results and saves them as a .png file.

Parameters

job_id: id of the redis job in the queue

Returns

The file of the plot.

This module is responsible to be able to download the results in json format. It makes the results available through an API.

app.routes.download_results.get_results_json_for_download(job_id)

Gets the result from redis and returns a json file.

Parameters

job_id: id of the job

Returns

The json file as a download, using flask’s object Response.

app.routes.image_transformation.image_transformation()

API for selecting an image and modify his property(color, brightness, contrast and sharpness). Returns the original and transformed image.

app.routes.histograms.histograms()

API for creating the histogram of a selected image: If the user clicks on the submit button the function will calculate the histogram of the image and pass it to the render_template function that will show the histogram_output html page. Otherwise, the select_histogram html page.
